issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: add analyze command to explictly cache file metadata in HBase metastore

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: implement metastore API to do file footer PPD

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: implement file footer / splits cache in HBase metastore

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Expr filtering, automatic caching, etc. should be aware of file types for advanced features. For now only ORC is supported, but I want to add a boundary between ORC-specific and general metastore code, that could later be used for other formats if needed.
fields.summary: add file type support to file metadata by expr call

comments.body:

I definitely like decoupling this from ORC.  The only concern I have is that I never intended HBaseReadWrite to be available outside the package, which this forces it to be (I think it already was for some tool or another, but that's only because Java's packaging is borked).  But I don't see a way around it, so, oh well.

+1
I am not adding any packages to that file, so I think the build errors are spurious. I will try locally before committing.
looks like this did break HiveQA build. I cannot repro these errors locally. Will revert for now.
I revered the patch. Looks like the hadoop-1 build is broken... cannot wait till we get rid of it :) Will investigate and update patch later.

Updated the patch. HBase metastore is using directory based excludes for hadoop-1, so I added the new code there too (otherwise it pulls the hbase classes in anyway thru an include). The non-nogen patch is now much smaller due to thrift 0.9.3 upgrade.
The patch taking hadoop-1 removal into account...
